column4: hey guys, i have a problem with my resolv.conf file. every time i reboot i have to edit it and delete a line in it, other wise i get dns errors
is there any way to fix it so i dont have to do it every reboot?
any ideas guys? i have to edit my resolv.conf file every reboot as it is right now
well the trouble is the dhcp server is giving you a bogus dns address - maybe that server's down atm?
my dhcp server is my router, and that is being set in my resolv.conf every boot for my nameserver, and there is another entry in there too
its like 205.something, and thats the one i leave in there, and comment out 192.168.0.1
yeah, what's happening is your router is sending both dns addresses - any way to turn that off on the router? (the 205. comes from the router's own dhcp)
no clue let me check, its a crappy dsl modem with a wireless router lol
i cant find anything about that
is there a checkbox for caching dns queries? try turning it of & restart everything
could it be NAT (name address translation)
no, you need nat unless you have a static ip
then i dont see anything for dns
k, well look for a firmware upgrade for your router
